### Set up model 

```{R Format Data for JAGS}
# Filter out just days that had calls
full_dat <- full_dat %>% filter(pct_days_wcall > 0)
# Pull out response covariate
days <-  full_dat$pct_days_wcall
# Pull out number of sites
n_unit <- nrow(full_dat)
# Transform to be between 0 and 1
# pct_days <- days/100
# hist(pct_days, breaks = 16, main = "All Sites", xlab = "% Days with Calls")
# hist(pct_days[pct_days>.005], breaks = 16,main = "Only Sites With Calls", xlab = "% Days with Calls")
```

```{R Set up JAGS Data, echo = TRUE}
# Create a list of data for JAGS
jags_data <- list(
  # Percentage of days with bbcu 
  y = days,
  # Covariates with a positive effect
  # % canopy landscape
  cov1 = full_dat$pct_can_landsc,
  # residual veg sd
  cov2 = full_dat$veg_sd_resid,
  # year
  cov3 = full_dat$yr_val,
  n = n_unit
)

# Set initial values 
init_func <- function(){
  list(
    beta0 = rnorm(1, 0, 1), 
    beta1 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    beta2 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    beta3 = rnorm(1, 0, 1)
  )
}
```

```{R Create Model Structure, eval = FALSE}
sink("C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/R_Scripts/2_Analyses/Habitat_Chapter/Poisson_Model/Model_Structure_Files/JAGS_HabLMod6_GamPois.jags")
cat("
    model {
    for (i in 1:n){
    
    # Impute missing habitat data
      cov1[i] ~ dnorm(0, 1)
      cov2[i] ~ dnorm(0, 1)
    
      # Method 2: gamma-poisson (this is equivalent to a negative binomial)
      # In this approach, the parameter of interest is the count of days with calls but we're also feeding it the number of days that we recorded 
      log(gamma[i]) = beta0 + beta1 * cov1[i] + beta2 * cov2[i] + beta3 * cov3[i]
      h[i] ~ dgamma(theta, theta)
      y[i] ~ dpois(gamma[i] * h[i])
      
    }

    theta ~ dgamma(1,1)
    beta0 ~ dnorm(0, 0.1)
    beta1 ~ dnorm(0, 0.1)
    beta2 ~ dnorm(0, 0.1)
    beta3 ~ dnorm(0, 0.1)

    }
    ",fill = TRUE)
sink()

```


```{R, results = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
fit_gpois <- jags(data = jags_data, 
                 model.file = "C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/R_Scripts/2_Analyses/Habitat_Chapter/Poisson_Model/Model_Structure_Files/JAGS_HabLMod6_GamPois.jags",
                 parameters.to.save = c("beta0","beta1","beta2","beta3"),
                 n.iter = 10000, 
                 n.burnin = 4000, 
                 n.chains = 3,
                 n.thin = 2,
                 inits = init_func)
beep()
# No warnings with this model
saveRDS(fit_gpois,"C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/R_Scripts/2_Analyses/Habitat_Chapter/Poisson_Model/Models_Ran_Outputs/LMod6_GamPois.Rdata")
```

### Examine model fit:

```{R Make Inference on P Value}
plot(fit_beta$sims.list$SSEobs,fit_beta$sims.list$SSEsim,xlab="SSEobs",ylab="SSEsim")
abline(0,1,lwd = 2, col = "red")
print(paste0("P value is: ",round(fit_beta$mean$p_val, 2)))
```

Based off of the p value, this model is ok. However, I think I should go through and do a bit more checking of this model, make sure it's actually converging properly and is an adequate fit for the data. 


```{R Create Plots of Posterior Distribution}
# Plot posterior distribution
chains_beta <- jags_df(fit_beta)
# Select the chains for our covariates of interest
chains_viol <- chains_beta %>% select(a1, a2, a3, a4, a5)
# Rename them to be more interpretable
colnames(chains_viol) <- c("Conifer Spp Richness","% Canopy Cover Landscape", "% SUBCAN cover landscape", "Veg SD Resid Core", "% SUBCAN cover core")
# Pivot this longer so that we can visualize it
chains_viol_long <- chains_viol %>% pivot_longer(cols = c("Conifer Spp Richness","% Canopy Cover Landscape", "% SUBCAN cover landscape", "Veg SD Resid Core", "% SUBCAN cover core"),names_to = "parameter", values_to = "values")

f_stat <- data.frame(
  parameter = c("Conifer Spp Richness",
                "% Canopy Cover Landscape", 
                "% SUBCAN cover landscape", 
                "Veg SD Resid Core", 
                "% SUBCAN cover core"),
  median_value = c(paste0("F: ",round(fit_beta$f$a1,2)), 
                   paste0("F: ",round(fit_beta$f$a2,2)),
                   paste0("F: ",round(fit_beta$f$a3,2)),
                   paste0("F: ",round(fit_beta$f$a4,2)),
                   paste0("F: ",round(fit_beta$f$a5,2)))
  )

# Create the slab interval plot
ggplot(data = chains_viol_long, aes(x = values, y = parameter, fill = parameter)) + 
  # Plot posterior distributions
  stat_slabinterval() +
  # Establish colors
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Conifer Spp Richness" = palette_5[1], 
                               "% Canopy Cover Landscape" = palette_5[2],
                               "% SUBCAN cover landscape" = palette_5[3],
                               "Veg SD Resid Core" = palette_5[4], 
                               "% SUBCAN cover core" = palette_5[5])) +
  # Add a line for 0 to show overlap of posterior
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0) +
  # Remove background color from plots
  theme_minimal() +
  # Turn off the legend
  guides(fill = "none") +
  # Add median values as text labels
  geom_text(data = f_stat, aes(x = .5, y = parameter, label = median_value), color = "black", hjust = .5)  
```
